string.value: #b#p1012003##k in #b#m100000000##k should be able to introduce you to a training center. Talk to Chief Stan.

There is apparently a place called the Bowman Training Center in #m100000000#. It's normally only available to Bowmen but Chief Stan says that he will write a letter of recommendation to #p1012118#, the Training Instructor, so that an exception can be made for you. Go to #b#p1012118##k in #b#m100010000##k.

There is a Bowman Training Center near #m100000000#. It should be quite useful if you haven't reached Level 20 yet. But as the name suggests, it's only open to Bowman... Well, since you did help me, I'll make an exception and let you use it.

If you take the Recommendation Letter I just gave you to the #b#m100010000##k, you'll meet #b#p1012118##k. He's full of hot air, but he is supposed to be pretty helpful. Just show him the Recommendation Letter to use the Training Center.

But why do you want to train? Is #p1013103# planning for you to become an Adventurer? You're not going to leave home and not come back like #p1052000#, are you? Hmm... Nevermind. Take care of yourself.
Are you not planning on using the Training Center? Then why are you asking?

Oh, are you a Bowman who's come to train? Or not... From the wand in your hand, you must be a Magician. What is that strange pet you have? I can't let anyone in who is not a Bowman. Huh? This is... #t4032456#?
Wait, a Recommendation Letter?! Stan is not compassionate enough to write something like this. Let me take a closer look.
Have you not gone to #b#p1012118##k at the #b#m100010000##k yet? Then again, I guess you might not want to train under someone who is so full of hot air...
How goes it? This is a Training Center for beginner adventurers. Only Bowmen under Level 20 may enter. All others will not be admitted unless they have a Recommendation Letter...
What? You lost the Recommendation Letter? You must be as clumsy as #p1013103#. Well, I suppose I'll have to write you another one so here.
